Introduction

Choi Ye-won, popularly known as Arin, is a South Korean singer and actress signed with WM Entertainment. She is the lead dancer and maknae (youngest member) of the girl group OH MY GIRL and its sub-unit OH MY GIRL BANHANA.

She earned her spot in the company after winning WM's auditions in 2013. She is nicknamed as "Giant Baby" for being one of the tallest despite being the youngest.

On April 20, 2015, she debuted as a member of OH MY GIRL with the group’s self-titled debut mini album. She also joined the group’s special sub-unit, OH MY GIRL BANHANA, with the special album Banana Allergy Monkey on April 2, 2018.

On March 10, 2020, Arin was cast as Oh Na-ri in Naver TV's web series The World of My 17.

In March 2021, it was announced that Arin was cast in Netflix's series Ghost Story 2.
